title: Strawpoll soloQ vs DynamicQ (Already 80.000 votes
body:
DynamicQ vs SoloQ

Vote here: http://strawpoll.me/7157281

Since riot is assuming the majority of the players are fine with dynamicQ, let's give them something to think about. I have never seen some survey from them, which to me, is a total excuse to cancel soloQ.

The only reason solo queue hasn't been released yet is because they know that nobody in their right mind would pick that shitty new queue over solo queue. They should just release solo queue already and admit that dynamic queue was just a stupid idea. It seems to me riot is proud of dynamicQ but they destroy the entire essence of compatitive play for the amateur players.

Anyways, WE care about distinquishing ourselfs from team players, since soloQ players are relatively more skilled than players that only do teams. Right now, soloq only players have a harder time to climb than soloq (2-4 man premade) people do. Why the living F do you want to group those together for the same, fking rewards?

If we go on like this, a platinum 1 SOLOQ ONLY player will be more skilled than a diamond 2 dynamicQ user.. Nice system, boys.

I quote socratis here;

"Hey guys, we know there are a lot of players who are really passionate about solo queue. We're not trying to be dishonest or dodge this topic. Radio silence on this the past couple months has been painful, we know. We hoped to come out with a direct answer to this, but working through the problems players are facing on live now (consistency around position select, queue times and matchmaking for high MMR) is taking longer than we initially expected. We did a bad job at managing expectations around this and deserve the heat we're getting around that.

That being said, solo queue does not directly address either of these problems and could suffer from the exact same problems. We'll be honest: there's definitely a world in which solo queue doesn't return, but we'd rather keep it on the table as we work through these issues before making a final decision."

360 downvotes already. Nice.

Let's say there are 100 people taking the survey. 
Of the two options provided by the creator of the poll, 40 choose option A and 60 choose option B
But some(Say 20) of the 100 people who've taken the survey are more or less indifferent on the topic. So, they just randomly pick a side. Sticking with the previous 40-60 ratio, 8 of those 20 "indifferent" people ended up picking option A, and 12 of the 20  "indifferent" people chose option B.

If there was a third, indifferent, option, and those 20 people chose it, it would be:
32 -> option A
20 -> indifferent
48-> option B

Doesn't matter, the majority still sides with option B. There are a lot of things which I haven't factored in.
More likely or not the 20 "undecided" people are split 50-50 ish. The ratios between options A and B aren't 40-60 
etc. etc.

That assumes a lot. 

What of 20 are indifferent, and most of them choose option #1? What makes you think that people who are indifferent will randomly choose one of the two options? Is there a reason behind that? And also, the question said "I would prefer soloQueue" and "I prefer Dynamic Queue" - the two questions are stylized differently, which might bring up more bias. "Would prefer" is a weaker position than "prefer", and people may be more comfortable agreeing with the "would prefer" because it allows for some leeway in deciding. People might be more attracted to "soloQueue" stylized in that way, instead of "Dynamic Queue". Then of course, one option is before the other. How about make the same post, at the same time of day on the same day of the week, putting Dyamic first - you might see different results. 

And then there area degrees to the opinion - What if some people want solo, but would rather have a choice between dynamic and solo? What if some people who prefer dynamic, but like having a solo option? What about the people who dont rank? What about the people who dont play norms? 

All these are considerations to find the true opinion of the community. And there are more i havent listed. Blindly saying it doesnt have a significant impact doesnt fix the problems with this poll.

I know it assumes a lot, and I mention that. It's a pretend situation. What if of the 20 indifferent, most choose option #2?

It could be: 
Most choose Option #1
Equal split
Most choose Option #2

2/3 of those outcomes still lead to a larger percentage of solo queue supporters when compared with dynamic queue supporters.

The "prefer" and "would prefer" is subjective, and varies from person to person. Margin of error, I guess.

Also, the post itself creates a lot of bias since OP included his hatred for dynamic queue over solo queue and basically rallied all agree-ers to vote with him. I'm no statistics major, but this poll is so biased and lacks enough credibility to be a waste of time and effort.

A poll like this needs to be at least 5 options to see how polarizing the results are. Joe Schmoe playing a game every once and awhile (the average player) is probably perfectly content with how things are right now and thus doesn't care about this poll.

The only way to get an accurate reading on this subject is for Riot to ask on a 5+ answer question where people fall on the Solo/Dynamic Q subject through their client with a pop up to avoid any response bias or sampling bias, which this thread commits both sins of.

There was no random sample that got the survey Riot sent that basically turned into confirmation bias about dynamic queue being good. They even admitted they basically targeted people that played lots of games with friends already, and the majority surveyed DIDN'T even play ranked.

What exactly is the difference? I doubt there were 80k people that were given that survey even, so the difference in sample size isn't that much different realistically. The difference is, you are just blindly taking Riot's word, where you can at least see the poll, but are making excuses for Riot so they don't even have to.

Nowhere did I claim one poll is better than the other. I simply provided facts to help people understand that this poll is no more valuable than the most dedicated proxy voter on either side.
